replies.body: I overrule your opinion with my opinion
As my granddad always said to me "Opinions are like a**holes. Everyone has one"

Opinions cannot be "correct", facts can.
Learn the difference between subjectivity and objectivity plz.

Thats a very surface level view on it. 

Its depends on what you mean by 'correct'. The concept of being Right or Wrong is a purely theoretical construct, created by humans to ease understanding. Right and wrong don't exist in the animal and plant kingdoms. 
This means that because there is no fundamental rule laid down by nature as to what is right and wrong, right and wrong is what humanity as a whole decides it to be. Therefore it is a majority rules, whatever the majority think is wrong, becomes incorrect, and what the majority considers right becomes correct. for example Smoking was once correct, it was beneficial to health and longevity, now it is incorrect as we know that to be inversely true. (this also implies that we see living as being correct) 

We as a whole view murder as incorrect, therefore we consider having thoughts about murduring someone, incorrect. When in reality, killing another member of your species is a natural thing. (lions often kill even their own children) but as effort o survive as a group we needed to feel safe, and the only way to feel safe among your own kind is to prevent you from killing eachother, so viewing murder as incorrect is a survival mechanism, its not some rule laid down by the universe. Incest is also considered incorrect because it makes the offspring genetically inferior, and thus cannot ensure the survival of the human race. So as a survival mechanism, we consider it incorrect and this prevent people from doing it. 

Therefore if having murderous or incestuous, thoughts is considered wrong in public opinion. That means that thoughts themselves can be wrong, and opinions are nothing but thoughts, so opinions can be wrong depending on society's current standing on it. 

Look at the Nazi's for example, it was their opinion that it was fine to torture and butcher anyone they thought was inferior. Now that is just their opinion, and they are entitled to it, but 99% of the population would consider their opinion to be wrong or incorrect. 

So if the Nazi's can have opinions that are incorrect, then that logic can be applied to every opinion.

However then we can have facts, for example I can be of the opinion that giving Zed mana will make the game more balanced, and you could be of the opposite opinion. Neither of us will ever know who's opinion would actually make the game more balanced.
BUT just because we cant measure something, doesn't mean it isn't there, either giving Zed mana or taking his resource away entirely, will very slightly make the game more or less balanced. We can never truly measure that change of course, but one change will be more correct than the other in making the game more balanced. This means that the idea's expressed in one of our opinions was wrong, and one was right. 

The Nazi's opinions are considered wrong, and that is 'subjectively' wrong because its a majority rules thing.
One of our opinions on Zed is considered wrong, and that is 'objectively' wrong, because regardless of what we think, there is a right answer and one of us will be right and the other will be wrong.

Sometimes the boards comes down to moral thing. Like the dispute about "ggez" recently. I'm not checking my replies from now on because when I make my initial argument that is what I needed to say, I don't want to ramble onto people with a different opinion.

But if it is a fact, disagreement is not an option. I'm trying to not look at the boards lately, because everyone takes everything too seriously and you can't have an opinion without been slaughtered by people that have become butthurt, then they go cry to a moderator or Riot and suppress you. This isn't a forum, this is a platform for people to cry about balancing and other people.

Even Reddit is more chill than this. If you want to have a civilized conversation about something League related your time is much better spent there.

The thing is, everyone has an opinion. 
But in the end most things only have 1 right answer _(wether we can ever know what the answer is tho, is completely different)_.

So unless everyone has the same opinion, someones opinion at some point, wether they are entitled to it or not, will be wrong. 

So: 
If you are right, and know someone else is wrong, what is the correct thing to do? 
Do you say: 
_"Yes! Thats your opinion, keep thinking that, and keep telling everyone else that, so that more people will think the wrong way."_ 
or do you step up and say: 
_"Sorry, but your opinion is actually wrong, THIS is the correct answer."_? 
In the former, everyone is happy and the problem continues, in the latter the problem actually gets solved, but not everyone is happy.

So in the end how hard you assert your opinion over others all boils down to what you value most: Do you value Political correctness, or do you value progress?

But remember, whichever you think is more important, is of course, just your opinion ;)

Well if we want to go Barry White deep with this, I value progress more than PC. Having said that;

_(You're so misguided)_ You know you're out of ideas when your counter argument is _"No! you're wrong!"_

No, truth is not synonymous with fact, there are **only** facts, truth is a linguistic term we have derived to claim those facts. 

Think about it, if truth exists then so must falsehood, but how can anything in the universe ever be false? Falseness can only occur when something is NOT true, but in a world without humans to speculate about what is true and false, everything IS true becasue there are only facts. There is nothing that can be false. But if everything is true, then the word 'truth' has no meaning, therefore there is just fact. Not truth, truth is an artificial construct, not a universal law.

Truth only occurs when there are several options to choose from, one option is true, the rest is false. But us humans create those options, the universe itself is only one option and that is fact, therefore nothing is true or false, it just **is**, Truth and Falsehood, are just words we have come up with to label our ideas and our theories about how the universe works.

You can question whatever you want, but at least i don't have to resort to insults to be right.

No essay posts don't validate points, what validates points is explanation. Your points are concise but full of holes, mine are not concise, but you have a far harder time picking them apart, _(which is something you have yet to do)_ because i thoroughly explain the point i have made for clarification.

I wish you luck as well.

Amoronsayswhat?

You are confusing morality (a term you should have, but didn't use) with objective truth/fact.
It is fundamentally held, that genocide is wrong, that is not a subjective belief or opinion.

Godwin's law in action here ITT boys, lap it up.

But there isn't an objective 'truth'. The concept of being true or false IS a man made construct, as is morality. 

Its not fundamentally held that genocide is wrong. If that were the case it would be prevalent in the natural world, many species have hunted others into extinction. From this we can deduce that genocide being wrong is a man made idea. If it were a natural rule that genocide is wrong, animals and plants would abide by it. But they don't.

Godwin's law is pointless, the same could be said about evolution, eventually in a discussion, evolution and the natural order of things will crop us as well. The reason those two things pop up? is because they are good methods of explanation, and comparison.

I can coin the Lord Sessomaru law right here and now: Eventually as a discussion progresses, you will become more likely to use an exaggeration to explain your view. 

Do you know why? because exaggerations are easier to understand and to differentiate a difference between two things, and thus are better at conveying a point. 

The Nazi's and Hitler are a defining point of the 20th century, and modern technology and views would NOT be the same if it wasn't for World War 2 (we wouldn't even have computers) so of course its going to be mentioned at some point, any idiot can see that. The fact that you CAN have an online discussion, is itself referencing World War 2.

So not mentioning it because someone with silly spectacles said you're likely to. Is counter productive, why have a good argument and then not use it?

You seem to imply that because Godwin said it would be used, somehow makes it less of good point, the validity of using Nazi's as an example hasn't changed just because someone predicted it.

I wasn't attacking you, I thought it was funny.
I was just pointing out that what others posted, that tried to present opinion as fact, were incorrect.
Their opinion wasn't incorrect, but holding opinion as fact is a farce.
